definition: to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Revisiting an old haunt is surely exciting.
sentences.chinese: 故地重游嘛，当然兴奋了。

sentences.english: There are plenty of coins in this lake. Everybody wants to come back again.
sentences.chinese: 这个湖里有很多的钱币，每个人都想故地重游。

sentences.english: When it photographed the same field yesterday, a refugee camp had already sprung up on the grass.
sentences.chinese: 昨天当它故地重游时，草地已经变成了一个难民营。

sentences.english: The one, who will visit this spa once, shall be back here again.
sentences.chinese: 一旦来此温泉度假，必定会故地重游。

sentences.english: No time to re-visit these sites and replenish our spirits.
sentences.chinese: 没有时间故地重游，去充实我们的精神世界。

sentences.english: Years after the fall of the Berlin Wall, he returned to the same sites, camera in hand.
sentences.chinese: 后来柏林墙倒塌，数年后，他带着相机故地重游。

definition: to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
to revive old dreams (idiom); to relive past experiences
things have remained the same, but people have changed
see 恍如隔世[huang3 ru2 ge2 shi4]
like a thing of the previous generation/as if it were a lifetime ago
to see each other/to meet in person
to reminisce/to talk about former times
scene which recalls past memories (idiom)/evocative of the past/reminiscent/to arouse deep feelings
old friend/sb who passed the county level imperial exam (in Ming dynasty)
to meet again after a long period of separation
